definition: lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: As he, in his swooning ears, the choir's amen.
sentences.chinese: 神魂顛倒的耳中，只想聽到唱詩班的歌。

sentences.english: He lost his head over that woman.
sentences.chinese: 他叫那個女人給弄得神魂顛倒。

sentences.english: In a word, Sophia was in love with him to distraction.
sentences.chinese: 簡單一句話，蘇菲亞愛他愛得神魂顛倒了。

sentences.english: Actually I am spaced-out all day.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，我一天都神魂顛倒的。

sentences.english: Her wit, her voice my heart beguiles.
sentences.chinese: 她的幽默風趣，她的悅耳聲音，讓我神魂顛倒。

sentences.english: Before him, of course, others had turned her head.
sentences.chinese: 在他之前，她當然爲別人神魂顛倒過。

sentences.english: It'll drive you crazy at first.
sentences.chinese: 一開始會叫你神魂顛倒的。

sentences.english: At first he'd be charming, sexy, sweep me off my feet. The electricity between us was amazing.
sentences.chinese: 一開始他很有魅力，很性感，把我弄得神魂顛倒。

sentences.english: I was carried away, seeing, absorbing many wonders.
sentences.chinese: 我神魂顛倒，目睹吸收了多少神妙之處。

sentences.english: Across the country, female fans shivered and went limp.
sentences.chinese: 全美國的女影迷都爲瓦倫蒂諾神魂顛倒，顫抖發狂。

sentences.english: Yes, Tom really turns me on.
sentences.chinese: 是的，湯姆真讓我神魂顛倒。

sentences.english: I love that red man-killer skirt of yours.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡你那條使男人神魂顛倒的紅短裙。

sentences.english: The moment the prince caught sight of the princess, he was head over heels in love with her.
sentences.chinese: 王子第一眼見到公主，就神魂顛倒地愛上了她。

sentences.english: Her eyes can touch one's soul, which attracts a lot of men.
sentences.chinese: 眼神攝人心魄，令很多男人神魂顛倒。
噢，鮑勃真讓我神魂顛倒。

sentences.english: The son is so captivate with the woman that he does not heed his parents' warning.
sentences.chinese: 兒子爲這個女人神魂顛倒，全然不顧他父母的告誡。

definition: fig. restless, because of fear or strong emotions
to envy/to admire
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
to adore/to admire greatly
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
love at first sight
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
every movement/each and every move
to tease/to poke fun at
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
graceful/charming/feminine
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
elusive/hard to pin down/enigmatic
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
to remain unmoved
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
